intro: Stephanomeria fluminea, commonly known as the fluvial stephanomeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as riverbanks and meadows. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in disturbed soils.
